snippet: President Obama on Tuesday will begin laying out his case for an expanded military campaign against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria when he faces congressional leaders.
abstract: Pres Obama is set to lay out his case for expanded military campaign against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria to congressional leaders who are averse to taking an election-year stand but are being pushed by lawmakers who want a say in matters of war; Obama has yet to indicate whether he will seek congressional authorization.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN, MARK LANDLER and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: President Obama on Tuesday will begin laying out his case for an expanded military campaign against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria when he faces congressional leaders.

headline.main: As Obama Makes Case, Congress Is Divided on Campaign Against Militants
headline.print_headline: As Obama Makes Case, Congress Is Divided on Campaign Against Militants

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
